subject: Re: [junit] How to run same testcase with 20 different  arg-values to test diff. results
msgSnippet: ... I forgot one thing: 4. Your constructor must call super( testMethodName ); before setting the test fixture. The parameter to super() must match your test
messageBody:
>So said J. B. Rainsberger on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>>So said suyash_says on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>>
>> Hello every one. !!!
>> Pls help me. i want to run the same testcase with 20
>>different set of values of an arg that gives me 20 unique results. I
>>don't want to hard code these values. Is there some dynamic way to do
>>so that doesn't increase overheades of writing test case.
>> Regds
>> - Suyash
>
>Yes, there is. Here is a sketch of the solution.
>
>1. Add a constructor to your TestCase subclass that accepts the parameters
>you want to use for each test. Store those parameters in the test fixture
>(instance variables).
>2. Create ONE test method that uses the test fixture and runs the test.
>3. Create a suite() method that loops through your test data and uses your
>new constructor to push test data into the test fixture.

I forgot one thing:

4. Your constructor must call super("testMethodName"); before setting the test fixture. The parameter to super() must match your test method name. You do not have to call the test method 'test*'. It just has to take no parameters and return no value.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
